content.text: This document introduces new features, enhancements and support information, and reports resolve and known open issues for this release of Blue Planet.

Beginning with the 20.10 release, all Blue Planet products require the use of a license server. Be sure to include this requirement in your hardware plans, and read the requirements, installation, and upgrade instructions to ensure you set up and use the license server.
The following table lists the Blue Planet UAA Release Notes publication history.
The following table contains software solution compatibility release information -
The bug fixes for 23.08.64 includes the fixes made in previous releases. For detailed list of bug fixes, refer the respective release list below.
Additionally, several internal bug fixes and performance improvements have been made in this release.
Ignore any inconsistency warnings in the information page of UAA related to backend and frontend core versions.
Nagios UI is displaying critical errors for Redis
Auto trigger of External Database Query Action Template to a workflow fails while succeeds if triggered manually from the Alarms and Events page
Unable to obtain the Operational State information of End Points using Swagger API
The system is not able to collect the PM data if an End Point uses a Performance Monitoring Template which has more than one Performance Threshold Policies assigned to it
Generation of table widget using compute data is fails while fetching the metric columns for the widget
Manually renaming the auto discovered node name does not update the source value for the associated endpoint to match the new node name
Filters are not working as expected post migration of filters from Legacy vSure to UAA
Post creating a new Custom Alarm Field, the data migration seems to have suspended without any errors or warnings
pdp.facts kafka topic used for ROA alerts is not getting created
Candy count is shown 0-0 for all alarm types on Alarms and Events page
The alarm count on the candy bar is not displayed
Getting exception error while trying to update service segments using import or swagger-ui
Backward compatibility is broken which is not allowing to update the service segments
Add support to merge Service Endpoints based discovered on multiple Network Elements by the same service
UAA does not support Services that span across multiple EMS systems
Relative change from last poll alarms is not raising for some values even though it matches criteria in Performance threshold policies
Alarms will not raise even if the criteria is matched
Relative change from last poll alarms is raising for wrong set of values in RA threshold policies
Alarms are raising for wrong set of values
Metric chart is not showing completely when baseline is plotted
When baseline is enabled, the metric charts will not be displayed correctly
User needs to configure Email properties in 2 places: 1 in UAA-UI for alarms/Workflows etc., and another in CORE-UI for Reports/Dashboards
User will have to configure their email in 2 places
Users should not be allowed to login with case sensitivity on usernames
Users are allowed to login with case sensitive on usernames
Make sure to use different usernames for each user rather than using changing usernames with just case sensitivity
Import of user, usergroup through csv (as per import/export guide of UAA) is not supported
Import of users and usergroup will not work
Import bulk user using swagger-ui is supported; Refer UAC swagger-ui API: /api/v1/users/bulk_user_creat e
Resource Adapter Updates available notifications can be configured to send to only one Email
No option to configure multiple emails to get notifications
Scheduling of Dashboard Components does not work
Scheduling does not work for users
No Localization support for Visualizations, Reports, Dashboards, Users, User Groups and Roles pages
Content will continue to display in English
No Localization support in Query filters with alarm properties
Content will continue to display in English
RA Customization Rules with period schedule doesn't get applied in alarms
RA Customization Rules with period schedule doesn't get applied in alarms
XLS - Failure in XLS Inference use case from 2nd execution
XLS inference use case will not work after 1st execution
AI SDK - Error when registering and loading models from ML Flow for Fiber Degradation
Unable to register and load models for ML Flow
Through import, ep-positions and A-Z plots are not updating for existing services
ep-positions and A-Z plots of endpoints will not work when created by import
Do not use the import option for A-Z plotting and ep-positioning
Actual functionality of customer dashboards is working fine.
Topology and fault widget data is displaying under customer Dashboard when customer does not have any service associated
Actual functionality of customer dashboards is working fine. Displaying all content when customer does not have any service associated
Med core container getting into inconsistent state (intermittently) when there is a split-brain scenario
Has impact on state transition and inventory functionality
Restart solutions after the system is recovered from network outages
Known Issues (Core UI issues impacting UAA)
UAA table pages will take longer time to load (~10 sec) for the first time when a new table page is opened
Users will see slowness in the table pages to load for the first time and if any operations are performed in that time period
Users will have to wait for the table to load completely first time and start using the system

Dataset will not be created for trendline/Percentile series widget

Will not be able to change the token value
Create additional widget for each token value separately

Service impact analysis (SIA) supported for Rings.

header: Include Time Element to RCA (Root Cause Analysis)

content.header: Include Time Element to RCA (Root Cause Analysis)
Include Time Element to RCA (Root Cause Analysis)

content.text: Enhanced graph-based correlation to add more scenarios allowing to suppress alarms as the Root Cause alarms. Additionally, disabled default Alarm Correlation Policies when RCA is implemented.
This helps in Providing multi-level parent child correlation support and increasing efficiency by grouping more symptomatic alarms to right root cause alarm.
If ACP & RCA are both enabled concurrently, it could result in a conflict where alarms may get related to each other and suppressed.
RC alarm must have higher priority classification than the Classification 'OTHER_FAILURE'.

header: Alarm details page includes list of Related Services, to aid understanding of alarm impact

content.text: This feature allows users to track and view all the service associated to an alarm in UAA. Whenever an alarm is raised on any node or service, the user can view list of services that could be impacted by the alarm.

Alarms are raised in the alarms and events page if there are problems with the UAA cluster for threshold alarms, capabilities to monitor performance metrics associated with different areas, run workflows, etc.

header: Improvements to avoid Loss of Communication (LoC) alarms during system restart

content.text: When the SBC is restarted or an instance of SBC goes down the adapter instances are lost, so a reconnect is to be done to create the same. Current SBC would trigger an SBC_CLOSE_CONNECTION that would reconnect the node and raise a LOC.
content.header: Improvements to avoid Loss of Communication (LoC) alarms during system restart

content.text: If there is no adapter to poll/query the device, that particular request is skipped, and an error is logged specifying that the adapter is missing.
content.header: Improvements to avoid Loss of Communication (LoC) alarms during system restart

content.text: Periodic keep-alive is improved to check for the adapter instance and will trigger a RECONNECT_NO_ADAPTER message to the med-core. Med-core would reconnect the nodes without raising any LOC alarms
content.header: Improvements to avoid Loss of Communication (LoC) alarms during system restart

content.text: Keep-alive is periodically performed based on the communication settings on the nodes whose connection state is one of the following -

Review the additional limitations listed below before deploying Blue Planet Unified Assurance and Analytics. Workarounds and plans for resolution in future releases are provided where applicable. All issues described below will be resolved in a future release unless stated otherwise.
The contextual linking between UAA and ROA works only for EVPN, EVPN-VLLS, EVPN-VPLS,
VPLS, L3 VPN, VLL, Tunnel service types. Users need to make sure that the UAA and ROA are installed under the same cluster having same Site IP.

UAA now forecasts PM based on the historical trend of the PM collected. A new Forecast button is added along with Live and History button. Clicking on the Forecast button, the individual PM chart gets reloaded with the PM forecast (in dotted line) and historical anomalies (if any are plotted on the chart with a red dot).

Anomalies are currently detected against historical PM data timelines and are not predicted for future timelines, but PM value forecasts are. Furthermore, no alarms are triggered as a result of the detected anomaly.
The Forecast is available for all time period - Day, Week, Month, Year, or Custom.
To calculate the forecast PM, the historical data of the same time period is taken as reference and the forecast data for 20% of the future time period is plotted.
Vulnerable version of log4j is used in UAA-ROA integrator present under
Installing UAA-ROA integrator will make the system vulnerable to the log4j vulnerability issue as described below.

In Apache Log4j2 versions up to and including 2.14.1 (excluding security releases 2.3.1, 2.12.2 and 2.12.3), the JNDI features used in configurations, log messages, and parameters do not protect against attacker-controlled LDAP and other JNDI related endpoints. An attacker who can control log messages or log message parameters can execute arbitrary code loaded from LDAP servers when message lookup substitution is enabled.
Since there is a combo lineup TAR separately available to install UAA and ROA, during deployment skip the all lineup containing UAA-ROA integrator under UAA TAR.

During service edit, endpoints are not retained.

While creating the service, add External ID as a mandatory parameter. No error notification will be observed, and endpoints will be retained properly during edit. Same holds good for service delete as well.
